meeting_annotations.speaker: Carolyn Bayer
meeting_annotations.transcript: Hi everyone, I'm Carolyn Bayer. I'm at Tulane. I'm really excited to be here. I'm a neuroscientist and I study the molecular mechanisms of learning and memory. And I'm really interested in how we can use that information to help people learn better and to help people with cognitive disorders. So I'm really excited to be here and to learn from all of you.
